alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 9:45PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT... .A fast moving storm system will sweep across the region tonight. Snow, moderate to heavy at times, will taper off from west to east overnight, ending in eastern Wisconsin by around 2 am. After the more significant snow ends, a mix of light snow, freezing drizzle or drizzle can be anticipated through about daybreak. Lake-effect snow showers will increase across Vilas County later Friday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow tapering off to light snow or freezing drizzle after midnight. Lake-effect snow showers developing on Friday. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches. A light glaze of ice accumulation is also possible. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
